summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by a U.S. Magistrate Judge authorizing the forensic review of 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein's person and properties. The devices were seized during his arrest and from searches of his New York City residence and private island in the Virgin Islands. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the warrant; devices were seized from his person and his residences. He is identified as a co-conspirator in the underlying offenses.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Specifically named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The search aims to find evidence of communications with her.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: The judge who signed and issued the search and seizure warrant on June 26, 2020.

connections.description: The warrant explicitly identifies Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the subject offenses, and authorizes a search for evidence of communications between them.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein and device seizure
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI, and two electronic devices (an iPad and iPhone) were seized from his person.

events.title: Search of 9 East 71st Street, New York
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's New York City residence, resulting in the seizure of 33 electronic devices from various rooms in the mansion.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James island
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's private island in the U.S. Virgin Islands, resulting in the seizure of 27 electronic devices from multiple structures.

events.title: Warrant issued for device review
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein issued this search warrant authorizing forensic review of the 62 seized devices for evidence of specified crimes.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Epstein's New York residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's private island)
St. Thomas Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: A total of 62 electronic devices were seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties: 2 from his person at arrest, 33 from his New York mansion, and 27 from his private island.
The warrant explicitly names Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein and authorizes a search for evidence of communications with her.

The search is for evidence of violations including sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), transportation of minors, enticement to travel, and conspiracy, covering the period from 1994 through August 8, 2019.

The warrant authorizes a search for specific categories of evidence, including nude or sexually suggestive photos of individuals who appear to be teenage girls or younger, and evidence of payments to victims and co-conspirators.
The document indicates the FBI had already conducted the physical seizures in 2019, and this 2020 warrant authorized the forensic review of the devices' contents.
